source_id: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_011_chunk1
evidence_span: Expanding mandrel laboratory simulations of the pellet-clad interaction (PCI) mechanism (including argon, iodine, and cadmium environments) were employed to evaluate copper barriers and zirconium-lined tubing performance.

source_id: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_011_chunk1
evidence_span: Zircaloy-2 and copper-plated and zirconium-lined barrier tube specimens were tested in the unirradiated (cold-worked) and in the irradiated (recrystallized) conditions at about 600 K

source_id: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_011_chunk1
evidence_span: Zircaloy-2 and copper-plated and zirconium-lined barrier tube specimens were tested in the unirradiated (cold-worked) and in the irradiated (recrystallized) conditions at about 600 K

source_id: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_011_chunk1
evidence_span: Tubing was irradiated at 620 K to a fast (E > 1 MeV) fluence near 2×10^25 n/m²

source_id: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_011_chunk1
evidence_span: Tubing was irradiated at 620 K to a fast (E > 1 MeV) fluence near 2×10^25 n/m²

source_id: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_011_chunk1
evidence_span: Brittle CI-type failures were produced in unirradiated Zircaloy-2 tubing by expanding mandrel loading with iodine and cadmium.

source_id: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_011_chunk1
evidence_span: Failure strains were further reduced for irradiated Zircaloy-2 tested in each embrittling environment.

source_id: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_011_chunk1
evidence_span: In contrast, high-strain ductile ruptures were produced in both unirradiated and irradiated tube samples tested in argon.

source_id: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_011_chunk1
evidence_span: In contrast, high-strain ductile ruptures were produced in both unirradiated and irradiated tube samples tested in argon.

source_id: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_011_chunk1
evidence_span: Zirconium-lined Zircaloy was not embrittled by cadmium even after neutron irradiation.

source_id: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_011_chunk1
evidence_span: High average failure strains and ductile fracture surface features were observed for the zirconium-lined tubing tested with cadmium

source_id: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_011_chunk1
evidence_span: Similar experiments with low-pressure (4 to 40 Pa) gaseous iodine produced brittle cracking in the zirconium liner and in the underlying Zircaloy, both before and after irradiation

source_id: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_011_chunk1
evidence_span: Similar experiments with low-pressure (4 to 40 Pa) gaseous iodine produced brittle cracking in the zirconium liner and in the underlying Zircaloy, both before and after irradiation

source_id: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_011_chunk1
evidence_span: Copper-electroplated Zircaloy tubing also exhibited excellent resistance to simulated PCI failure for both irradiated and unirradiated conditions when exposed to iodine or cadmium.

source_id: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_011_chunk1
evidence_span: Copper-electroplated Zircaloy tubing also exhibited excellent resistance to simulated PCI failure for both irradiated and unirradiated conditions when exposed to iodine or cadmium.

source_id: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_011_chunk2
evidence_span: Unirradiated Zircaloy tubing was embrittled by localized cladding deformation at a range of average strain rates with both gaseous iodine and liquid or solid cadmium environments maintained at several concentration levels.

conditions.medium: gaseous iodine, liquid cadmium, solid cadmium

source_id: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_011_chunk2
evidence_span: The expanding mandrel configuration summarized in Fig. 3 was employed to evaluate both unirradiated and irradiated tube specimens exposed to either argon, cadmium, or iodine environments at elevated temperatures.

source_id: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_011_chunk2
evidence_span: Cladding temperatures of between 573 and $6 2 3 \mathrm { ~ K ~ }$ were established by an induction heating coil

source_id: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_011_chunk3
evidence_span: Tests were conducted with purified argon flowing through segment interfaces at $3 \times 1 0 ^ { 3 } \mathrm { c m } ^ { 3 } / \mathrm { h }$ and a pressure of $1 2 0 \mathbf { k P a }$ to establish performance in an inert environment.

source_id: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_011_chunk3
evidence_span: argon at the same pressure and flow rate was circulated through pure, anhydrous iodine crystals maintained at either 273 or $2 9 6 \mathrm { ~ K ~ }$ to produce iodine partial pressures in the carrier gas of 4 and ${ \bf 4 0 P a }$ , respectively

source_id: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_011_chunk3
evidence_span: argon at the same pressure and flow rate was circulated through pure, anhydrous iodine crystals maintained at either 273 or $2 9 6 \mathrm { ~ K ~ }$ to produce iodine partial pressures in the carrier gas of 4 and ${ \bf 4 0 P a }$ , respectively

source_id: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_011_chunk3
evidence_span: Solid cadmium experiments were conducted at $\$ 73\mathrm { \textrm { K } }$ after premelting at $6 2 3 \mathrm { ~ K ~ }$ for $^ { 1 / 2 } \mathrm { ~ h ~ }$

source_id: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_011_chunk3
evidence_span: Solid cadmium experiments were conducted at $\$ 73\mathrm { \textrm { K } }$ after premelting at $6 2 3 \mathrm { ~ K ~ }$ for $^ { 1 / 2 } \mathrm { ~ h ~ }$

source_id: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_011_chunk3
evidence_span: Liquid cadmium tests were conducted at 608 K, 14 deg K above the melting point of cadmium.

source_id: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_011_chunk3
evidence_span: The unirradiated sample, tested at $\$ 73\mathrm { \textrm { K } }$ , failed at a high average diametral strain of 5.3 percent

source_id: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_011_chunk3
evidence_span: The irradiated specimen was loaded to a high diametral strain level of 4 percent, without evidence of through-wall rupture.

source_id: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_011_chunk3
evidence_span: Expanding mandrel loading of standard Zircaloy-2 with low-pressure gaseous iodine, liquid cadmium, and solid cadmium environments produced through-wall cracking at greatly reduced diametral fracture strains

source_id: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_011_chunk3
evidence_span: Expanding mandrel loading of standard Zircaloy-2 with low-pressure gaseous iodine, liquid cadmium, and solid cadmium environments produced through-wall cracking at greatly reduced diametral fracture strains

source_id: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_011_chunk3
evidence_span: Expanding mandrel loading of standard Zircaloy-2 with low-pressure gaseous iodine, liquid cadmium, and solid cadmium environments produced through-wall cracking at greatly reduced diametral fracture strains

source_id: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_011_chunk3
evidence_span: In all cases, irradiation further reduced diametral fracture strains.

source_id: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_011_chunk3
evidence_span: Iodineassisted cracking of cold-worked unirradiated Zircaloy-2 proceeded by apparent cleavage cracking and subsequent ductile rupture of remaining ligaments.

source_id: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_011_chunk3
evidence_span: Cracking in recrystallized, unirradiated Zircaloy-2 tubing was, in contrast, largely intergranular

STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_011_chunk6
evidence_span: Similar good high-strain performance was observed for zirconium-lined Zircaloy-2 tubing tested with gaseous iodine in both the irradiated and unirradiated conditions

source_id: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_011_chunk6
evidence_span: iodine-assisted cracking was observed in the zirconium liner, albeit for samples that were strained to large expansions compared to Zircaloy-2

source_id: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_011_chunk6
evidence_span: neither liquid nor solid cadmium environments embrittled copper-plated Zircaloy-2 tubing

source_id: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_011_chunk6
evidence_span: Irradiation hardening had no deleterious influence on barrier performance

source_id: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_011_chunk6
evidence_span: copper-plated tubing far outperformed standard Zircaloy-2

source_id: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_011_chunk6
evidence_span: Brittle cracks were probably not produced in composite tubing at low strain levels

source_id: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_011_chunk6
evidence_span: Copper- and zirconium-modified fuel cladding did exhibit significant PCI resistance for both iodine and cadmium environments maintained at high concentration levels

source_id: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_011_chunk6
evidence_span: The failure strains of irradiated, copper-plated and standard, unplated Zircaloy-2 tube specimens were essentially equal as for tests conducted in an inert argon environment

source_id: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_011_chunk6
evidence_span: irradiated and unirradiated iodide zirconium was embrittled by iodine, but at higher fracture strains compared to Zircaloy-2 tested under comparable conditions

source_id: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_011_chunk6
evidence_span: cadmium embrittlement of iodide zirconium has only been found for high-strength forms of the metal (i.e., cold-worked or irradiated) loaded to very high strain levels compared to Zircaloy

source_id: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_011_chunk6
evidence_span: Simulated PCI loading of Zircaloy-2 cladding in an argon environment did not produce brittle failures, even after neutron irradiation to moderately high fluences

source_id: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_011_chunk6
evidence_span: the introduction of either an iodine or cadmium environment produced low-strain, brittle cracking in both irradiated and unirradiated Zircaloy, with the lowest strain failures being observed for irradiated material

source_id: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_011_chunk6
evidence_span: Both copper-plated and iodide zirconium-lined barrier cladding significantly outperformed the standard Zircaloy cladding in all environments

source_id: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_011_chunk6
evidence_span: Moderate fluence irradiation exposures had no effect on the PCI resistance of the composite tubing

source_id: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_011_chunk7
evidence_span: Thirty-five chemical elements and some of their compounds were tested for activity in the embrittlement of Zircaloy-2 at $\$ 73$ using constant extension rate tension tests.

source_id: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_011_chunk7
evidence_span: Besides iodine, which embrittles by stress corrosion cracking (SCC), five metals caused liquid metal embrittlement when dissolved in cesium. These were cadmium, zinc, yttrium, calcium, and strontium.

source_id: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_011_chunk7
evidence_span: The effect of cadmium was by far the most severe.
